thread.title: 5th grade coed team was asked to kick the girls out, so they forfeited their season instead
thread.title_full: 5th grade coed team was asked to kick the girls out, so they forfeited their season instead

author: Kofie Yeboah
title: 5th grade coed team was asked to kick the girls out, so they forfeited their season instead
text:
Now that’s a true team.
We all know that “Ball is Life,” but sometimes life tries to interfere with ball.
According to a story on NJ.com , a team of nine boys and two girls forfeited the rest of their season after the league’s director said that the girls would no longer be allowed to play on the team.
The 5th Grade St. John’s CYO basketball team, which already had years of experience playing together, now faced a conundrum. 
Drop the girls and keep playing? Or forfeit the remainder of the season?
The parents asked the kids. 
"Is your decision to play the game without the two young ladies on the team, or do you want to stay as a team as you have all year?" asked parent Matthew Dohn. "Show of hands for play as a team?"
Eleven hands shot up in unison. No one raised a hand when asked the alternative.
It's good to know kids still do the right thing and support each other https://t.co/9aZRYOlA4g 
— Duane (@duanezapain) February 12, 2017 This can't get RT'ed enough. There is a whole lot of good in us still. So impressed by these 5th graders. https://t.co/HejNummjYw 
— Todd Kalinosky (@tkgoblue) February 12, 2017 While the other team left the gym, St. John’s decided to play anyway. They split up their 11-person team and decided to have a game of their own.
Through the hurdles and obstacles that people try to throw at you, Ball is Life.
